JLutils
  • Reference

Percent formatter (English)

Multiply by 100 and display a percent sign.

percent(x, digits = 1)

percent0(x)

percent1(x)

percent2(x)

percent3(x)

percent4(x)

percent5(x)

comp.percent(x, digits = 1)

comp.percent0(x)

comp.percent1(x)

comp.percent2(x)

comp.percent3(x)

comp.percent4(x)

comp.percent5(x)

Arguments

x

a numeric vector to format
digits

number of decimal digits to display

Details

percent0(x) is a shortcut for percent(x, digits = 0), percent1(x) for percent(x, digits = 1), etc. comp.percent(x) returns the complement to 1 of x, i.e. percent(1 - x).

Examples

percent(0.004)
#> [1] "0.4%"
percent0(c(0.000045, 0.56789, 234.567))
#> [1] "     0%" "    57%" "23 457%"
percent2(c(0.000045, 0.56789, 234.567))
#> [1] "     0.00%" "    56.79%" "23 456.70%"
percent5(c(0.000045, 0.56789, 234.567))
#> [1] "     0.00450%" "    56.78900%" "23 456.70000%"
comp.percent(0.255)
#> [1] "74.5%"
